sentences.sContent: Luke came in with his hands in his pockets.
sentences.sCn: 卢克走了进来，双手插在口袋里。

sentences.sContent: The policeman told me to turn out my pockets (= take everything out of them ) .
sentences.sCn: 警察让我把口袋里的东西都掏出来。

sentences.sContent: ...what would lie expect them to do with their pocket money...
...What do we learn from the conversation about British children's pocket money...
...how much pocket money would you give them...
...do most children in your country get pocket money...
...What do we learn from the conversation about British children's pocket money...
...why do you think the rise in pocket money is often higher than inflation...
...what would he expect them to do with their pocket money...
...Now you've seen this table of figures about the pocket money children in Britain get...

synos.tran: 小型的，袖珍的；金钱上的

phrases.pCn: [美国俚语](吸毒时)处于心醉神迷的佳境中
气穴；（大气中使汽机突然下跌的）气陷
袖珍计算器；便携式计算器

words.tran: 可放在口袋里的；可供私用的；可隐藏的

trans.tranOther: a type of small bag in or on a coat, trousers etc that you can put money, keys etc in
